{"step_by_step_thinking": "Tetracycline is an antibiotic that can cause tooth discoloration, especially when given to children whose teeth are still developing. The discoloration is dose-dependent, meaning the higher the dose, the more likely it is to cause discoloration. However, the minimum dosage that can cause this side effect is generally considered to be around 20 mg/kg body weight.", "answer_choice": "B"}
